Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content:
is it possible that we can only give the command without the supply and reward and en ? for syncing with other nodes or is it necessary to do that ? i mean to say shall i give like that 
./komodo-cli -ac_name =EXAMPLECOIN -addnode=1.1.1.12 -addnode=1.2.2.13  ?? will that work

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: komodo-cli is local

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: komodod needs all the parameters, otherwise it is a different chain

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: but we are giving the parameter in the -ac_name is not enough for the komodod ?

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: do we need to give the full supply including the rewards and the end to our clients actually just want that hidden from the clients the suply and the rewards ?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: how is a node supposed to know the chain parameters if it never sees it?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe some repository of chain parameters can be setup, but for now each node needs to be given the exact parameters

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can just make a script file that encapsulates all the parameters and have users just run the script file

Author: D.rabbani#9094
Content: true that @jl777c  we can give that to the users thanks alot for the help

Author: Bar_F1sh_Rel#0834
Content: Kmdlabs startscripts encapsulate the chain params in a json file - pulled from git on activation. That works nicely.

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
I could use some help debugging this chain if anyone has some time right now. 
`./komodod -ac_name=PTX -ac_supply=12000000 -ac_end=12000000 -ac_staked=50 -ac_reward=1500000000 -ac_pubkey=0359e2ee32833398c26378a2bb0962f98a7d77f3f6e6e4d27316bcb85542f23c61 -addnode=104.168.134.47` 
Seems it's bugged out. I can connect to peers, but it will never start syncing blocks. Any ideas?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Has anyone ever experienced something similar?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @Alright is there any node with non 0 blocks amount?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: I get `18-11-17 05:18:54 connect() to 217.182.203.106:26435 failed after select(): Connection refused (111)` in debug.log

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Maybe node/s which got blocks have some network restrictions on connections

Author: Alright#0419
Content: all assetchains currently use KMD's DNS seeders

Author: Alright#0419
Content: that's where it got that address I assume

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
```  "blocks": 0,
  "longestchain": 0,
  "timeoffset": 0,
  "tiptime": 1231006505,
  "connections": 3,```
In general seems I have same situation as you

Author: Alright#0419
Content: do `getpeerinfo`

Author: Alright#0419
Content: you see peers with blocks, yes?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: All my peers have `"synced_blocks": -1`

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: I think ` "inbound":false` for all peers is a clue

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: I had quite similar issues when used cloud instances for AC building (by default inbound traffic was restricted)

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I believe "synced_blocks" is the amount of blocks you synced from that specific peer

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Ahhhh

Author: Alright#0419
Content: the inbound thing might explain it
